medical_history.chief_complaint: Chronic Lyme disease with associated neurological and musculoskeletal symptoms.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with an episode of Bellâ€™s palsy in August 1992, followed by cognitive decline, neck pain radiating to the left shoulder and hand, back pain radiating down the left leg, tinnitus, blurred vision, difficulty concentrating, and various other symptoms including fatigue and sweating. Symptoms improved with initial antibiotic treatment but recurred in July 1996, prompting additional therapy. Persistent symptoms have included fatigue, sweats, memory loss, generalized aches and pains, and facial numbness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, seborrheic dermatitis, and chronic Lyme disease.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of natural causes; mother died of ovarian cancer; brother recently underwent coronary artery bypass graft surgery.
medical_history.social_history: Lives in a suburb of Boston, works as a consultant, exercises regularly, and quit smoking 7 years ago. Rarely drinks alcohol.
